item.title: R Used in Literature

A brief description This post will summarize the advancement of using R to analyze data obtained in behavioral and relevant areas. 2. Prop <- Cnd_Prdct$Prop ptp <- car::powerTransform(Prop) summary(ptp) ## bcPower Transformation to Normality ## Est Power Rounded Pwr Wald Lwr Bnd Wald Upr Bnd ## Prop 1.

item.title: R的安装与配置
item.description: Windows R安装好后配置是本文的重点。关于Windows R的安装，百度有一大堆的教程。其中重点有3： 安装R，下载https://mirrors.tu

item.title: Theory of mind
item.description: 1. Theory of Mind (TOM) 2. False belief task 2.1 Change-of-location false belief task 2.2 Recent Applications 3. References 1. Theory of Mind (TOM) Theory of Mind is the human capacity to comprehend that other people hold beliefs and desires and that these may differ from one’s own beliefs and desires. Understanding others’ mental states is a crucial skill that enables the complex social relationships that characterize human societies.

item.title: Visual World Paradigm
item.description: 1. A brief description 2. Recent Applications 3. References 1. A brief description This paradigm relies on two seminal work published by Cooper (1974) and by Tanenhaus, Spivey-Knowlton, Eberhard, & Sedivy (1995). In a typical eye tracking study using the visual world paradigm, participants’ eye movements to objects or pictures in the visual workspace are recorded via an eye tracker as the participant produces or comprehends a spoken language describing the concurrent visual world.

item.title: 行列式 (Determinant)
item.description: 1. 二阶和三阶行列式 (Determinant) det() 和 determinant() 函数 args(det) ## function (x, ...) ## NULL args(determinant) ## function (x, logarithm = TRUE, ...) ## NULL 一个例子 data <- c(3, 2, -2, 1, 12, 1) data <- matrix(data, nrow = 2) data ## [,1] [,2] [,3] ## [1,] 3 -2 12 ## [2,] 2 1 1 D <- det(data[, c(1, 2)])

item.title: reshape
item.description: 1. reshape a data frame from wide format to long format d1 <- data.frame(subject = c("id1", "id2"), x0 = c("male", "female"), x1_2000 = 1:2, x1_2005 = 5:6, x2_2000 = 1:2, x2_2005 = 5:6 ) d1 ## subject x0 x1_2000 x1_2005 x2_2000 x2_2005 ## 1 id1 male 1 5 1 5 ## 2 id2 female 2 6 2 6 rs1 <- reshape(d1, dir = "long", varying = 3:6, sep = "_") rs1 ## subject x0 time x1 x2 id ## 1.

item.title: 自闭症视觉认知的神经模式研究
item.description: 1. 研究背景 自闭症是一种社交性的障碍。该项目想知道自闭症孩子在处理社会性视觉刺激时，其脑活动状态是什么。这些状态与正常孩子有什么不同。基于此研

item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Likan Zhan Add: 15, Xueyuan Rd., Haidian District, Beijing 100083, China Tel: +86 10 8230 3468 Email: zhanlikan AT hotmail DOT com Personal website: https://likan.info Academic appointment 2014.10 ~ Now, Assistant professor, MEG Laboratory for Brain Sciences, Institute for Speech Pathology and the Brain Science, Beijing Language and Culture University, Beijing, China Education 2010.10 ~ 2014.09, Ph.D. Cognitive Science, Macquarie University, Sydney, Australia
